events.message: The applicant submitted a personal loan application to fund medical expenses and clear existing debt, indicating urgent financial needs.
The loan was categorized under personal loans due to the stated purpose involving medical bills and debt repayment.
A loan officer was assigned to the case to facilitate communication and guide the applicant through the loan process.
The application underwent an initial review focusing on applicant's income stability and debt load relevant to the loan amount.
Additional documents were requested from the applicant including recent bank statements, medical bills, and proof of income.
The applicant promptly submitted all requested documents, demonstrating cooperation and seriousness about the loan.
Credit history was reviewed, showing a moderate credit score with some previous credit limits reached but no recent defaults.
The risk assessment evaluated the probability of default given the applicant's income, debts, and credit history.
A loan offer outlining terms suitable for the applicant's needs and repayment capacity was sent to the applicant.
The applicant provided positive feedback and requested minor modifications to the repayment schedule and interest rate.
Due to the requested changes, the application was escalated to senior management for approval of adjusted terms.
Senior management approved the revised loan terms, confirming the applicant meets the lending criteria satisfactorily.
Funds were successfully transferred to the applicant's account to cover their medical expenses and outstanding debts.
A call was made to the applicant to ensure the funds were received and to answer any questions regarding repayment.
The loan application process was officially closed following successful disbursal and positive follow-up feedback from the applicant.
